channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Speechify adds voice typing and voice assistant to its Chrome extension
item.description: Speechify has largely been a tool that helps you listen to articles, PDFs, and documents. The company is now adding voice detection features to its Ch...

item.title: The Best Mushroom Coffee, WIRED Tested and Reviewed (2025)
item.description: “Coffee” made with functional mushrooms like lion’s mane and chaga is all the rage. We tried the most popular brands to find which were the most palat...

item.title: 11 Best Down Comforters (2025), Tested in Our Homes in Every Season
item.description: The best down comforters keep you cozy and comfortable no matter the season. After sleep-testing multiple options, our top pick is the Premium from Qu...

item.title: Spotify to raise US prices in first quarter of next year, report says
item.description: Major record labels have been urging Spotify and other music streaming platforms to raise subscription prices, arguing that fees have not kept pace wi...

item.title: Can Tech Get Rid of Bad Trips?
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, we talk about some of the latest drug trends and all the ways drugs are changing as they continue to be intertwined...

item.title: Wish List 2025: A WIRED Gift Guide
item.description: 27 thoughtful and beautifully designed gifts, chosen by WIRED's editors.

item.title: India’s gig workers win legal status, but access to social security remains elusive
item.description: India is restructuring its gig economy with a new labor law, but much more is needed before gig workers see real benefits.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Goes on the Offensive
item.description: Two years after he was found guilty of fraud, FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried is pursuing a legal appeal—and firing up his X account.

item.title: Google teams up with Accel to hunt for India’s next AI breakouts
item.description: Google and Accel will jointly invest up to $2 million in each startup through their new partnership.

item.title: Altman describes OpenAI’s forthcoming AI device as more peaceful and calm than the iPhone
item.description: Altman and Ive tease a simple AI device aimed at calm, distraction-free computing, launching within two years.
